Articles.Content:
This was a thread that got deleted.Decided to reboot.Continue on

How i found

SOLAR GAMER
Well i find KSP in 8.0 Ob Google looking for Rocket building game found it. downloaded the game fell in love like that! but did not join forums tell may.
In the off topic section of the Natural Selection 2 forums.
Saw some youtube videos of Robbaz massacring Kerbals by the dozen a few days ago. The hilarity made it an instant purchase for me.

ha. by pure chance, one day I found myself watching a youtube video of rocket crashes/explosions.

one of the top comments was:

Kerbal Space Program!

at first I thought "Kerbal" was an ex-soviet republic (like, Kazakhstan) - and I was like, "those guys actually have a space program?"

a wiki search ensued.

10 minutes later I was playing the .13 demo.

the rest is history
Had the urge to play Orbiter again. Ran across this game when getting the link off the Wikipedia Orbiter page. Can't stop playing.

I actually found it in the mouseover text of the webcomic XKCD. I believe it was the productivity one where he chases after balloons. Anyways, I thought at first it was just a Moon landing simulation game, but then I checked out the official site and immediately knew I would love it. I downloaded the demo right then and there, then got right into building rockets. It wasn't long after that I bought the full verson, which was 0.18.2. It's been about 4 months, and I think it was the best game purchase I have made in my entire life.

I love this game, so much that I have to force myself to stop playing it when it comes to exam time (like right now :'( )

I was browsing a game development forum, where someone posted an idea to create a game about building spaceships from parts and flying them. Then someone asked, how would it be different from the Kerbal Space Program. Minutes later I was on youtube watching videos and shortly after that playing the demo, and finally buying the game.

It was when 0.14 just came out. In love with it ever since

In a Fark.com discussion thread on video game violence. (Someone was listing off great non-violent games, especially those not dumbed down for the lowest common denominator. This and Minecraft were held up as examples of good, cheap games that didn't insult your intelligence.)
It's been a year and a half, I have no clue how I found it, I think it was a YouTube video.
Jesse Cox did a Fan Friday video of KSP. He killed some kerbals and exploded some rockets, I was sold.

I found this on a game review show, and always at the same time when I discover things, on an annual 1 month holiday (Btw, I despise holidays) with only access to a phone with a 2g connection that cuts out for 30 minutes every 10 minutes.
